channel.title: Installation on Jaeles Scanner
channel.description: Recent content in Installation on Jaeles Scanner

item.title: Burp Integration
item.description: Plugin can be found here and Video Guide here How to get JWT First time you run Jaeles, it’ll setup some config and credentials at ~/.jaeles/config.yaml POST /auth/login HTTP/1.1 Content-Type: application/json User-Agent: Jaeles Scanner Host: 127.0.0.1:5000 Content-Length: 54 Connection: close { "username": "jaeles", "password": "your_password_here" } Use that credentials to get your JWT. You can run jaeles server without authentication with -A option but keep in mind that some signatures allow execute command on your machine.

item.title: Persistent Burpcollaborator
item.description: Get Collaborator Secret token Burp -> Project Options -> Connections -> Upstream Proxy Server -> then run command below mitmdump -q -p 8667 -s burpcollaborator-oob.py Burp -> Project Options -> Connections -> Mics -> -> Burp Collaborator Server. Check on Poll over unencrypted HTTP.Now open Collaborator Client and click Poll now.Copy as many collab as need to be and store it in a file.Default log will be store in .
